name: AMERICAN STATES INSURANCE COMPANY, Appellant, v. George B. WINELAND, III, and Virginia Wineland, his wife, individually and as Parents and Natural Guardians of Seth Wineland, a Minor

parties: AMERICAN STATES INSURANCE COMPANY, Appellant, v. George B. WINELAND, III, and Virginia Wineland, his wife, individually and as Parents and Natural Guardians of Seth Wineland, a Minor.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
MONTEMURO, J., is sitting by designation.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Timothy J. Burdette, Stephen J. Poljak, Anstandig, Levicoff & McDyer, P.C., Pittsburgh, for appellant.
Richard Serbin, Joseph J. Nypaver, Levine, Reese & Ser-bin, Altoona, for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
655 A.2d 980
AMERICAN STATES INSURANCE COMPANY, Appellant, v. George B. WINELAND, III, and Virginia Wineland, his wife, individually and as Parents and Natural Guardians of Seth Wineland, a Minor.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued March 8, 1995.
Decided March 28, 1995.
Timothy J. Burdette, Stephen J. Poljak, Anstandig, Levicoff & McDyer, P.C., Pittsburgh, for appellant.
Richard Serbin, Joseph J. Nypaver, Levine, Reese & Ser-bin, Altoona, for appellees.
Before NIX, C.J., and FLAHERTY, ZAPPALA, CAPPY, CASTILLE and MONTEMURO, JJ.
